title: Suzuki MOQBA
description: Suzuki's MOQBA is a modular electric quadruped-wheeled vehicle that climbs stairs and adapts to chair, stand, or stretcher modes.
fullDescription: Unveiled at the Japan Mobility Show 2023, MOQBA is Suzuki's bold concept for next-generation urban mobility. It blends four electric wheels with robotic legs, enabling movement on flat surfaces and climbing stairs. Designed for accessibility, emergency response, and small-scale transport, this modular prototype can adjust its configuration for seated, standing, or stretcher use. The innovative design represents a paradigm shift in personal mobility, combining the efficiency of wheeled transport with the adaptability of legged robotics to navigate complex urban environments that traditional vehicles cannot access.

specifications.Architecture: Four robotic legs, each with 3 degrees of freedom, ending in electric wheels
specifications.Riding Modes: Chair Mode (seated driving), Standing Mode (upright control), Stretcher Mode (patient transport)
specifications.Mobility: Legs compress and extend to adapt to terrain, with speed bumps and stairs traversal via leg articulation
specifications.Range: Up to 80 km (50 miles) per charge
specifications.Modularity: Interchangeable attachments include wheelchair, cargo basket, robotic arm, or stretcher
specifications.Terrain Capability: Flat surfaces, stairs, curbs, and various urban obstacles
specifications.Power Source: Electric battery system with regenerative capabilities

capabilities: Stair-climbing: Ascends and descends steps one leg at a time while keeping passengers level
Versatile configurations: Transitions smoothly between chair, stand, stretcher, or cargo use
Enhanced accessibility: Tailored for elderly, disabled, emergency services, or deliveries in complex urban environments
Adaptive terrain navigation: Automatically adjusts leg positioning and wheel configuration based on surface conditions
Modular functionality: Quick-change system for different operational modes and attachments
applications: Urban commuting & Last-mile travel: Ideal for navigating curbs and staircases in cities
Accessibility mobility: Empowers those with limited mobility to reclaim independence
Emergency response: Quickly transport patients or supplies in challenging environments
Light logistics: Carries goods, groceries, or refuse through built-up areas
Healthcare support: Mobile assistance platform for medical facilities and home care
